results.content: I enjoyed the course and I recommend it for students who are already familiar with building Angular apps. I like that the instructor uses a consistent folder structure, and that he uses consistent steps in implementing the logic. Consistency and repetition encourages a deeper mental imprint on me, meaning I remember the steps more clearly. This course contains almost all of the components needed to create an application where users log in, maintain local state, maintain persistent (database) state, and support a shopping cart. It shows all steps to stand up a Firebase-hosted website. Thank you to the instructor for a clear and comprehensive course! (It would be helpful if the instructor zoomed in on his screen (of 3rd party URLs) to make the content easier to see.)
results.content_html: I enjoyed the course and I recommend it for students who are already familiar with building Angular apps. results.content:
Straight forward approach. The partitioning into modules and inside them is good, seems to very apt in terms of objectivity.
Hierarchical topology of modules/components make a lot of sense. I enjoy this one.  I hope he goes further into payments and ideas how to publish docs or video docs, that would be something

results.content: The content is awesome, but his english is a nightmare :)
results.content_html: The content is awesome, but his english is a nightmare :)

I am hearing challenged. No caption so I had to use google transcribe on my phone to translate the audio to text to follow up with the training. Secondly, the tutor seem to rush at some points. For example the tutor was trying to add code at the visual studio Angular environment ...
environment.prod.ts
......true,
firebase:
{
// The tutor did not add anything here
]

It really cause confusion.

results.content: My experience on this curse is great and  very explained
